info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:58PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Martin and southern Dawson Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 458 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southwest of Lamesa, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sparenberg, Tenmile, Patricia and Klondike. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
